previous: The following is a partial list of aircraft that were powered by the R-2800 (and a few prototypes that utilized it at one point):

The suffix W e.g.: -10W denotes a sub-series modified to use A.D.I Anti-Detonant Injection or water injection equipment, using various mixes of water and methyl alcohol (CH3OH) injected into the carburetor to increase power for short periods: several models of R-2800s were fitted as standard with A.D.I and did not use the W suffix.[nb 1] Few commercial aircraft used water injection.
